answers.answer: she probably has thin fat pads to the bottom of the foot.when at home, have her wear fleece/sherling lined house slippers to help give her cushion.when in shoes, i recommend diabetic shoes.  they are lined with plastizote that cushion the feet.  they should be covered by insurance b/c she is a diabetic.

question: My mother-in-law is 90 years old and she has pain across her foot under her toes.  She has put a pad on the floor to stand on to make it easier to stand up at the kitchen sink.  I have ordered her a nonslip pad to stand on.  She has type 2 diabetes.  This pain is constant when she is up and calms down after she lies down on the bed.Any suggestions?  Thank you
title: pain beneath the toes
